body.header: Questions 1-8. Listen to the recording, which will play automatically, and follow the instructions. Complete the notes below. Write NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS OR A NUMBER for each answer.
body.section:
LectureParticipants: Lecturer and large groupWhat happens: Lecturer talks, students take notesAims: Guide students through course, draw students' attention to (1)
SeminarParticipants: Tutor and between (2) studentsWhat happens: Students present topic, tutor and students (3) as a groupAims: Help students to: (4) , make critical judgements, form opinions
TutorialParticipants: Tutor and individual student or small groupWhat happens: Tutor and students discuss workAims: Give students guidance on their work, help students with (5)
Practical WorkParticipants: Individual student or small groupWhat happens: Students take part in (6) Aims: Provide students with practical experience
Independent StudyParticipants: Individual student or small groupWhat happens: Students research a subject and then produce written work or (7) Aims: Help students to develop (8) , provide opportunity for further study, encourage students to develop their own ideas

p.font: 1. Dr Grant says that one of the aims of the lectures is to help students focus on the main points of the course. 'Help students focus' means the same as 'draw their attention'.
3. Dr Grant says they have a group discussion. The gap required a verb not a noun so you had to change the form.
5. Dr Grant says that tutorials give students 'assistance' with study problems and 'assistance' means the same as 'help'.

section.p: You will see from the headings in the table and the information given that you will hear someone talking about the different methods of study. You will hear the lecturer talk about who is invited, what they do and the purpose behind the method. You will also see that you have to complete the table horizontally, row by row. Question 1What part of speech follows 'draw attention to'? You should be listening out for a noun or noun phrase. What do you think is brought to the students' attention in a lecture? Question 2The word 'between' should indicate to you that two numbers will follow. Question 3You should see that you have the subject here so need a verb as the next word. What do you think the tutor and students do in a seminar? Question 4What should follow 'help to'? Question 5What do you think students need help with? Question 6 Read the rest of the row in the table. What is the name of a method of study whereby you get practical experience? Question 7What else do students do after they have done some research? Question 8Read the rest of the row. What kind of skills do you think students might be developing?
